newsitem.title: HONG KONG: Indonesia mandates banks for standby facility.
newsitem.headline: Indonesia mandates banks for standby facility.

text.p: The Republic of Indonesia, acting by and through Bank Indonesia, has mandated seven international banks to arrange a US$500 million syndicated standby facility, J.P. Morgan said on Friday.

The seven mandated banks are Commerzbank (South East Asia) (documentation), Fuji Bank, IBJ Asia (agent), J.P. Morgan Securities Asia (overall coordinator, including publicity), NatWest Markets, Sanwa International Finance and Tokyo-Mitsubishi International (HK) (Japanese books).
The facility has a tenor of eight years and will be fully revolving.
The interest rate will be calculated at an annual rate equal to the London Interbank Offered Rate plus a margin of five-eighths of one percent.
General syndication will start in approximately three weeks and signing is expected in mid-March.
Proceeds will be used to provide general purpose funds for the Republic of Indonesia.
